total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation of the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is three times the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Identify the rule for filling the output grid. The original input grid is repeated three times both horizontally and vertically.
Q4: Notice that the first cell of each row and column in the output grid is filled with 2 if it was originally 0 in the input grid.
Q5: Apply these rules to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation of the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is three times the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that every cell in the input grid is replicated three times in both dimensions in the output grid.
Q4: Identify the rule for transforming the value of the cells in the input grid to the output grid. Notice that the cells with value 0 in the input grid are transformed to 2 in the output grid.
Q5: Apply the transformation rule to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
